arts.ttl: Graham Potter explains Brighton transfer system
arts.sum: Ex-Brighton manager Graham Potter explains the club's transfer process

arts.ttl: Welbeck earns Brighton hard-fought win at Newcastle
arts.sum: Though Gordon scored from the penalty spot against City, before missing against his former club at Goodison Park, Newcastle appeared a different side with a recognised striker in the form of Isak. A sprawling Verbruggen denied Isak when one-on-one just after the half-hour mark before Brighton scored against the run of play, Welbeck playing a one-two with in-form Rutter before poking past Nick Pope .

arts.ttl: Mitchell sees Newcastle issue as Brighton escape after stadium error
arts.sum: Despite dominating possession, goal attempts and showing much more of a desire to go and win the game, Eddie Howe's side were left frustrated as Seagulls stopper Bart Verbruggen kept them at bay throughout . Yet Saturday's clash with Brighton showed some of that old Newcastle bite as Howe's attacking stars hurried and harassed from the front in the opening half, while Joelinton and Bruno Guimaraes covered every blade of grass with or without the ball in the second period.

arts.ttl: "I didn't like us" - Eddie Howe's honest response after Newcastle United's £100m call goes wrong - Chronicle Live
arts.sum: Howe's side looked disjointed after the break and with the likes of Almiron, Bruno Guimaraes, Tino Livramento and Anthony Gordon not enjoying a full week of training, it was put to the head coach that a lack of preparation may have played a part. Howe told Chronicle Live: "I don't think our substitutions today necessarily helped our performance.

arts.ttl: Fabian Hurzeler backs match-winner Danny Welbeck to play into his 40s
arts.sum: The 33-year-old was carried off injured during the second half at St James’ Park.

arts.ttl: Lapse in concentration cost Newcastle - Howe
arts.sum: Newcastle United boss Eddie Howe says a lapse in concentration caused his team 1-0 defeat by Brighton after a "dominant" first-half performance in the Premier League at St James' Park.

arts.ttl: Newcastle United player ratings slump with two 5s & a 4 while Isak gets benefit of doubt
arts.sum: Eddie Howe's team also plunged into their sixth hour without a Premier League goal from open play with stagefright in danger of setting in for the front men. Barely tested before Danny Welbeck goal.

arts.ttl: Brighton suffer injury blow ahead of Wolves and Liverpool clashes
arts.sum: Brighton forward Danny Welbeck looks set for a spell on the sidelines after picking up an injury against Newcastle United on Saturday. The former Arsenal and Manchester United player scored the only goal of the game to give the Seagulls victory at St James’ Park. It was his 100th goal involvement (72 goals, 28 assists) […] The post Brighton suffer injury blow ahead of Wolves and Liverpool clashes first appeared on The Football Faithful.
Brighton manager Fabian Huerzler says his side were "defensively impressive" during a 1-0 win over Newcastle in the Premier League at St James' Park.

arts.ttl: Seething Eddie Howe holds immediate Newcastle inquest as £100m Plan B fails miserably vs Brighton
arts.sum: Isak had watched one effort cannon off the back of a defender while also seeing his clinical touch desert him in another opening as he watched a ball drift past him right in front of goal. Howe will hold an immediate inquest behind the scenes but whether it is a lack of minutes in the legs for Isak, a lack of good service or just general complacency there seems to be a problem for Newcastle after five hours without a goal from open play in the Premier League.
